result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Brandon Kuhl in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:19 AM Court calls case.
Atty Constable states appearances.

Defendant does not appear today.

Atty Kuhl does not know where his client is. Ms. Hegeman is homeless and Atty Kuhl has called three different numbers.

State requests warrant, body only.

Court reviews the charges.
Notice was sent out to last known address - 1625 Wyatt Avenue. Defendant does not appear.

BY THE COURT:
Court authorizes a bench warrant for arrest, $500 cash alternative

Prior: 2900 Lindbergh, Stevens Point, WI 54481

2/23/15 - Bond is amended to remove the day report condition.

ADDRESS INFO for Breeann M. Hegeman
Current: 2900 Lindbergh, Stevens Point, WI 54481   (Effective: 02-18-2015)
Prior: 1625 Wyatt Avenue, Stevens Point, WI 54481
Pre-trial conference on April 27, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Breeann M. Hegeman in court with attorney Brandon Kuhl. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

NOT GUILTY plea entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond Continued. 

Atty Kuhl makes arguments re: day report. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond condition to day report is removed.
Portage County Community Justice Program Court Referral Form
Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  *Every Day*  No contact with G.Z.

ADA Constable  appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

1:22 PM Court calls case.

ADA  Constable states facts for anticipated charges of Resisting and Obstructing an Officer.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
Defendant is 19 yrs old, lives in her car, 1625 Whiting Avenue.
Defendant does not have a job, previously worked at Dollar Tree.

State requests a cash bond  with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  February 23, 2014  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2
